title: Bug 38131ajc needs -d option while correctly compiling classes from subpackage
OB: When compiling a class in a subpackage using ajc command without the -d option, a 'subpackage' directory is created under the existing 'subpackage' directory.
EB: ajc creates a subdirectory with the same name as the subpackage when compiling a class from a subpackage.
SR:
To reproduce:
1. Create a class in a subpackage.
2. Use the ajc command without the -d option to compile the class.
3. Check if a 'subpackage' directory is created under the existing 'subpackage' directory.
